questions.question: High-yield savings accounts typically offer:
questions.explanation: High-yield savings accounts, especially from online banks, typically offer 10-20x higher interest rates than traditional brick-and-mortar banks.

questions.question: The best strategy for building savings is:
options: save whatever is left at month end
save only when you have extra
questions.explanation: Paying yourself first with automated transfers ensures savings happen consistently and removes the temptation to spend.

questions.question: Money market accounts typically offer:
questions.explanation: Money market accounts typically offer higher interest rates than regular savings accounts while maintaining liquidity.

questions.question: FDIC insurance covers up to:
questions.explanation: FDIC insurance covers up to €250,000 per depositor, per bank, per account type.

questions.question: The most important factor in choosing a savings account is:
questions.explanation: Interest rate and fees have the biggest impact on your savings growth, making them the most important factors.

questions.question: Name one benefit of automating your savings:
questions.explanation: Automating savings removes the need to make decisions each month and ensures consistent saving behavior.

questions.question: What is the difference between a checking and savings account?
acceptable_answers: checking is for daily transactions, savings earns interest
savings has limited transactions, checking has unlimited
savings earns interest, checking typically doesn't
checking has debit card access, savings doesn't
questions.explanation: Checking accounts are designed for frequent transactions and daily use, while savings accounts are for storing money and earning interest with limited transaction access.
